title: P3 Programme officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: Interview are competency based. The questions include a question to introduce yourself, your skills and how your experience contributes to the job. Then a set of 3 -4 competency questions related to the skills required for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you communicate complex information to senior management? what would you do? how would you prepare?

title: Senior L&D Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Competency based interview with request to illustrate specific examples of projects I recommend using the STAR model to answer - specific examples are expected. Explain your role and responsibilities and how you solved specific challenges
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you facilitated a training/designer a learning solution

title: Knowledge Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well but they never got back to me to tell me I didn't get the job or to give me any feedback. This caused me a lot of stress and they never replied to my emails.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Knowledge Management?

title: Stage curriculare Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Colloquio troppo complesso per il livello di posizione (stage), inoltre le persone che hanno fatto il colloquio non volevano rispondere alle mie domande riguardo la posizione. Li ho trovati scortesi nel complesso.
Interview Questions: esperienze di lavoro in team, domande specifiche riguardo la posizione

title: Logistic Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: Very good process with constat updates and feedback provided after the interview. The whole process took around 4 months from an initial screening, through a written test, until a final oral interview conducted via zoom.
Interview Questions: Competence based with technical insights

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: The process was okay but required me to do so much work. They got back on time to tell about my interview outcome. I feel like it is unfair to give someone that amount of work only to decline them a position.
Interview Questions: Creating content Copy writing Video editing

title: Knowledge Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: I had a 1 hour interview with 3 employees. The interview was full in English, but unfortunately they didn't give me a feedback. The interview was the classics questions and answer the job interview with examples using the star method.
Interview Questions: Examples of the job offer

title: Information Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: The interview was structured as a comprehensive panel session comprising of four to five competency-based questions, a format that aligns with the standard practice observed in interviews conducted by the World Food Programme (WFP)
Interview Questions: Definition of food security Managing conflict Managing information management projects

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: It took around 1 month for them to contact me through my personal email. The interview was over zoom. They asked specific and general questions. Around 1-2 weeks later I was sent an offer.
Interview Questions: What is my experience with deadlines? Can I talk about WFP? Why do I want to work for their team?

title: Junior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: apply online the got a Phone interview with the hiring manager to discuss the job and the requirement for the job process is one month and you have to fill up a online cv
Interview Questions: What is you experience with data analysis

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me for an interview after 4 months, and I was told what I was being interviewed for (there were several positions within the division) at that moment. It was a panel interview, which felt like an interrogation. I did not get a positive response, but it took them another month or more to tell me that through an automatic decline message.
Interview Questions: Given that I was not told before exactly what they were interviewing for in the beginning, I prepared for the division's general work, however I was asked specific questions to the role.

title: Associate Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: This was the best interview I have ever done! The individuals on the panel made me feel so welcomed and valid, they gave me credits for my answers and seemed genuinely interested to listen to me. In total it took 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: General interview questions including motivation

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about skills, experiences and the Organization itself. The interview lasted about 20 minutes. No feedback and very unprofessional communication, have not heard back even after asking for an update.
Interview Questions: Skills, experiences and knowledge about the Organization

title: SAP Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Processo di colloquio ben strutturato. Unico colloquio gestito con metodologia STAR. Giusto mix tra tecnico e skills organizzative e sociali. Condotto alla perfezione. Uno dei migliori colloqui a cui abbia mai partecipato.
Interview Questions: Situazioni e task progettuali Simulazioni relative al progetto Simulazioni di ufficio Richieste tecniche Altro

title: Junior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly slow process as it's usually the case with prestigious institutions such as the UN etc. Totally non-personal email, where I was invited to complete a written task. After nearly one month past completion, I discovered by myself on the career portal that my recruiting process was over. One week later, the person I was "in touch" with, sent me a formal rejection email. Really demotivating. There was no interview, but the writing text wasn't easy - which is understandable for this kind of institution.
Interview Questions: No interview question, just a written task.

title: Junior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a junior consultancy position in mid-November. At the end of December I had an assesment in which I had to record myself answering several questions. At the beginning of January, I was contacted for an interview a week later. At the interview I was told that I would hear about the process in two weeks, but a month has passed and I still haven't heard anything. I am very interested in the position, I have sent an email to follow up but I have not received a reply. I have read in several blogs that the process can take quite a long time, but as I was told it would take two weeks to receive news, I understand that it is because I have not been selected. Has anyone had a similar experience?
Interview Questions: Questions related to the position

title: Internship HR Global Talent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: First i send my CV, motivational letter and other documents. One month later i received an email to make a PP presentation. The first interview was one week later with the HR team and the last interview with the Head Officer.
Interview Questions: Motivation, experience, how you manage stress, how you schedule your day and behavioral questions.

title: Knowledge Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: Good rapport with competency based questions. There were 3 panelists with the hiring manager. They seemed impressed. I was contacted by the team assistant and my profile on the recruitment platform changed to “congratulations, you passed to the interview stage”. I wrote a test a week before being invited for interview.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult colleague in the past?

title: Marketing Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to a Teams-interview with the Head of the unit and two other communications specialists. It took 30 minutes and I got 4 technical questions, all about my competence and experience. The people were very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Which are the challenges you see for our organisations?

title: FIT Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple. I applied for a FIT Pool position, and was offered an interview after 4 months of applying and after an online assessment. The interview questions were behavioral questions, simply asking to define myself, my past experiences and why I am motivated to apply for this position. I was also asked about my strengths and weaknesses, and what I would have done to avoid a conflict situation with my colleagues.
Interview Questions: - Strengths - Weaknesses - How do you manage a project - How do you avoid conflicts?

title: Regular Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: 1) Send CV and cover letter via the online platform 2) written assessment based on technical knowledge necessary for the role 3) panel interview with potential colleagues and a representative from the admin / HR department.
Interview Questions: Why are you fit for the role?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: A 30 to 40 minute telephone interview which surprisingly mostly  focused on competencies as opposed to technical questions and previous experience. Also  brief CV overview.  At the end of the interview there is a possibility to ask questions which is what I believe can make a difference. It is a chance to show that you know what you are applying for and what to expect. At this point, it should also be mentioned that the selection process is very competitive, approximately 800 applicants for one position. So what will really get you the job is your initial application.
Interview Questions: 1)Describe a situation where you had to communicate a complex issue to an audience unfamiliar with your area of expertise.

title: Visual designer consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed, after presenting a design assignment, by the current visual designer whom I’d be working with if hired. Questions made were very much design oriented. Didn’t passed on to next step due to the results of my assignment. Each step takes a fairly long time to obtain feedback from.
Interview Questions: How do you usually handle a design project?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a written technical examination and upon passing a panel interview via Skype. Questions centered on past relevent experience, competencies and overall fit within the team.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for the role?

title: Partnership Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: The recruitment process included a written assessment, a language test and two rounds of interviews (a video interview through HireVue and a live panel interview with three Partnership Officers and a member from HR)
Interview Questions: Both the video interview and the panel insisted a lot with behavioural questions on receiving feedback, reacting to a negative situation and dealing with difficult stakeholders.

title: Business Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It has represented a long process. They send you the Written test to do in a proctored environment and then oral interview after different months from application. It could last less.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Ho mandato la candidatura online. Dopodiché, ho sostenuto due prove scritte: una attitudinale, in cui mi hanno fatto domande in stile colloquio e una tecnica con 3 problemi. I tre problemi erano: scrivere un negotiation brief, analizzare dei dati su Excel, e creare un powerpoint per una campagna di raccolta fondi. Infine, sono stato invitato al colloquio.
Interview Questions:
D: Perché vuoi lavorare nel WFP?
D: Dimmi di una volta in cui ti sei dovuto adattare in fretta ad una situazione che è cambiata rapidamente.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Dopo aver effettuato l’application online sul sito sono stato contattato e ho sostenuto un colloquio conoscitivo e tecnico con i responsabili della funzione ricercata per la posizione in questione
Interview Questions: Descrivi le tue passate esperienze lavoratove

title: Deputy General Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Compilazione form World Food Programme con inserimento dati personali ed invio di Curriculum Vitae e Lettera di presentazione; la compilazione è molto complessa e richiede un notevole impegno di tempo
Interview Questions: Esperienze precedenti, preparazione accademica; impiego attuale; retribuzione

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The Interview consisted of five to six competency based questions involving past experiences, strengths, and weaknesses.
After the technical assessment, there is a video interview assessment, then the final interview.
Questions such as my motivation, technical skills were not fully focused on as much as the competency aspects.
Interview Questions: Have I ever been in a leadership position? what was the most challenging thing I had to do as a leader

title: Programme policy officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Technical written test of two hours with specific questions on the region,  followed by panel interview of 45 minutes. Overall it was a pleasant experience and the impression was that even those candidates that did well but were not selected would have been considered for other positions.
Interview Questions: A couple of general questions on motivation and background followed by specific questions

title: Budget and Programming Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was interviewed 7 months later, overall the interview was good and not difficult . it was done online and there were 3 people on the panel. most of the questions were behavioral iterview questiosn
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a colleague

title: Editorial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was cold-contacted/recruited for an interview for a contract position in a new department that was slated to last only two months after the date of the interview. Prior to the interview, I had to sit a writing test and pen an in-depth feature article where the specs weren't completely clear.
Interview Questions: I can't remember the specifics of what they asked me – it was all very vague because the department was new. The people interviewing me were really personable and kind, and clearly it would have been an interesting opportunity if it had gone forward. Unfortunately, I got the impression that they were instructed to hold interviews preemptively, ahead of actually forming the new department or guaranteeing its viability. I was told a few weeks after my interview that the position no longer existed / the opportunity was no longer available. It was a decent learning experience, but overall left me with a distaste for exploring more work in that sector.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Modena) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Come primo step ho fatto l'applicazion sul loro sito, ho letto molto, mi sono informata usando il materiale che ho trovato, quindi ho inviato curriculum,lettera motivazionale e ho compilato la loro domanda online. Poi è iniziata la selezione vera e propria, ho fatto una prova su Excel e Power point e una volta  superato questo step ho fatto due colloqui, con Business cases.
Interview Questions: Perché questa organizzazione umanitaria e non altre, cosa pensi di poter portare, punti di forza, debolezza

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: The interview was made of a first written assessment on the topic of the internships followed by a phone interview with the hiring manager. After the second step, I received an offer of internship.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of research project you’ve worked on

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Now im in the process...first they sent me invitation that i was picked from great ammount of applications. Then i passed 2 hours written test in computer (60 questions), 1 opened question(situation and report about it). Now im waiting for other tasks.
Interview Questions: I don't know yet

title: Clinical Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the WFP website. After 3 weeks I was asked to do an interview by zoom. I met with 4 people in the Panel. It was a challenging yet very interesting interview. They asked me about the application and some background history. They asked why I want to work for the WFP. I received an email one week after saying that although my interview was very good, I didn't get the job because of the lack of experience in the UN system.
Interview Questions: Why I applied for this job. What's the value I could bring to the WFP Team? What was my experience with the family system model. What was my experience working with UN. Conflict resolution example in a Team. An example of strategic communication.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: Overall a pleasant experience. Great hiring manager. Very clear, efficient and professional communication. A telephone interview took around half an hour, interviewers called exactly on the arranged time and were friendly and polite throughout.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply? How your experience matches the position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: At first the ask you to do a task in 3 hours and half  at home and than they call you for an interview in their headquarter to ask you some questions
Interview Questions: when was the time you had difficult working in a team and how did you resolve it?

title: Programme policy officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first stage was a 120 mins written test which had 4 questions. The second and final stage was a 45 min video interview with a panel of 4 WFP personnel.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging encounter in your previous or current employment and how did you manage to overcome the challenge?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The invitation to Interview was an e-mail that had been forwarded, which I felt could have been avoided to make it feel more personal. I had two interviews, pretty normal competency based questions around teamwork and leadership skills. I applied for the position in December,  first Interview was in April and the next one in May, so a rather lengthy process! After 3 weeks, I asked for feedback and was advised they would get back to me after 2 more weeks. I asked one more time after that and I have still not heard anything back from them. I will leave it at that. I understand that there are a lot of candidates for these positions, but I still think they should have the courtesy to inform you if you weren't successful after your interviews or just update the online status... I am left feeling rather disappointed.
Interview Questions: What makes you a leader and not a follower?

title: Senior IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Colloquio di persona presso la loro sede. Durata complessiva circa 1 ora. Domande sull'esperienza lavorativa, sulle motivazioni. Spiegazione complete del ruolo e delle responsabilità. Presente il responsabile IT e HR
Interview Questions: QUal è il motivo principale che ti spinge a cambiare lavoro?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Got a call from rome headquarters to confirm about my availability after 2 days. After a week , got an email for a skype interview. Two people from the department that would assign the interview took interview for about 25 mins. They introduced themselves and also about the job and responsibilities of the intern.
Interview Questions:
what is your motivation to work here.
questions related to past projects i had been involved in.
situational questions about how you deal with a difficult person and about time management and team work.

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and had to also include a sample of a report I wrote. I was then called for a panel interview with senior managers and HR. The questions were quite technical and based on a series of experience I had in the past, related to the job description.
Interview Questions: Questions about partnership - fundraising - coordination skills

title: Intern - Due Diligence UNit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Envoi d'une candidature en ligne (CV et lettre de motivation), puis prise de contact par email pour un entretien téléphonique. Entretien d'environ 30 minute avec deux personnes. Due diligence + compétences personnelles et profil.
Interview Questions: How would you proceed to a due diligence check?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Sono stato chiamato per un colloquio di tirocinio. Sono stato invitato all'edificio del WFP a Roma. Sono stati molto professionali e  molto puntuali. Ho ricevuto una risposta negativa. Ma penso che sia ancora importante. Alcune organizzazioni non danno mai una risposta se è negativa.
Interview Questions: Abbiamo avuto una conversazione molto rilassata sulla mia istruzione e sulle precedenti esperienze lavorative. Mi hanno chiesto perché mi piacerebbe lavorare lì.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a written test that was to be completed in two days plus one phone interview with two panel members. The questions were mostly competency based and the written test focussed on technical skills
Interview Questions: How you would handle a request from a higher up if your boss could not be consulted to verify some information

title: Communication Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: After 3-4 weeks from the online application, I received a written test (24h to submit it), where I had to prepare an article for the intranet and a graphics. After other 2-3  weeks I was invited for a panel interview (via Skype), which was competency based. After other 2-3 weeks, I was invited for a second "meet-the-team" interview, again via Skype.
Interview Questions: The competency based interview had both HR questions ("Describe how you solved a conflict with a colleague" type of questions) and more technical questions on e.g. how I plan a communication campaign and what are the things I would keep in mind when doing so

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: I passed the Computer Skills Tests and the English Proficiency Tests at FAO and the person who chose me was in need of someone who had passes the tests to make sure she could receive the help she needed
Interview Questions: She explained the job only and told me my salary

title: Junior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with 3 interviewers. Normal interview questions with nothing unexpected really. They did ask what I knew about WFP so be able to eloquently talk about what WFP does and why your interest in this specific UN branch.
Interview Questions: What are your thoughts on knowledge.

title: Government Partnership Division Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application in April 2012. I was contacted in August 2012 with an e-mail inquiring whether I was still available and interested. The interview was scheduled one month later. I received a reply within one week.

title: Individual Fundraising Digital Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process. I applied online, the next day I was called for a phone interview and 3 days later I got the job. It was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions:
How did I fit the specific job requirements? 
Why did I apply?

title: Legal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted in two steps. The first was a written text (1 hour long) and was divided in 2 parts: in the first part was asked to draft a contribution agreement between WFP and a State, the second part concerned a legal advice regarding a WFP officer
Interview Questions:
Explain your background and career's plans
Questions on the immunities of UN's officers (which is the legal framework, why they have these immunities)
If the UN can be part of a trial
Which are the essential clauses in a contribution agreement

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed personally at WFP Headquarters. The interview lasted 1 and a half hours and I was told I would get a reply within the next few days. Not only did I never hear from them again, but when I wrote an email asking about the results of the selection process nobody cared to answer. Complete lack of respect and consideration from Human Resources, they were very unprofessional. Not at all what you would expect from a humanitarian agency of its calibre.
Interview Questions: Normal questions, especially focused on the use of software

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Milan) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a skype one
The interview was divided into two parts:
- in the first one, general questions have been asked
- in the second one, case study (you are a WFP member, you have to decide how much food and how much people send to Cairo Region, you cannot use a calculator)
the interviewer was nice
Interview Questions: present yourself

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, I was interviewed by three consultants and the second interview was the Head of Office. Questions were not hard and it was a pleasant experience. I was asked questions by all three consultants about what I would do in certain situations and what are my goals.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Microsoft office?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Milan) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Lots of mail and two Skype interviews with a very fast process.
All of this process was unproductive due to their strict guidelines regarding interns and to the lack of attention of the recruiters (no appropriate interviews with a brief and rude mail to explain the negative feedback): it looked like they needed an intern (maybe for the summer) but they're looking for a perfect candidate.
Interview Questions: General questions, the second interview (with the HR Director of the branch) was really quick, it looked like he was in a hurry

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online in November and was called for a phone interview in December after which I was asked to write a report, summarizing the  interview I had. A few weeks latter, I was invited for a technical text which was sent to me via email and I had to submit my response within 24 hours. This was the most intensive UN (technical) text I have ever written (I have written more than 10 of them for other UN organization). Basically, I was given a report, based on which I had to prepare my audit plan. I was then invited to Rome for a Face to Face interview after which I was supervised to write a 2 hour management test mainly to test my soft skills and how I am able to prioritize my work in the real work environment. After this, I had the opportunity to be interviewed by the Inspector General. 8 of us made it to this stage.  A few weeks latter, they came back to me saying the position has been offered to a more senior candidate. However, because they were very impressed with my performance through the whole process, they would offer me a lower level position (which was one level lower than what I had applied for) if I would accept it and depending on my performance on the job, I will be considered for that higher level post if any became vacant in future. well, I was very disappointed but it sounded like a very good opportunity for advancement in my career and it was in the field I had longed to get back to so I accepted. Additionally, they had given me a very good impression of WFP throughout the whole process so .... it sounded like an organization I would love to be a part of.
Finally and lastly, I was invited for a French test since I had listed French as my second language. My phone number was given to a testing company to call me and their number was also given to me. Because I had already read on this site about someone's experience where he was called an hour latter than I agreed, I decided to call the  testing company myself when they were 10 minutes late. It was an oral and listening test to determine my level in French. The evaluator was speaking at normal speed so it was not very fast. some of the questions asked were: tell me about yourself, what will you do this weekend, where do you normally go when you want to be alone, where would you like to go on pension, describe how to make tea, how will you describe the global economy to someone, what will you say to a friend who invited you to a party but you would not be able to attend because of other commitments etc. In all, I think they asked about 20 questions but I am not very sure and it took exactly 30 minutes to complete the test. I googled how to prepare for a language test and I found many helpful sites. One of the most helpful websites had an article called "How to prepare for a foreign language oral or speaking exam and succeed and do well". All the tips given here were very helpful. There was also another site with an article called "How to prepare for your foreign language oral exam".
Soon after writing the exam, I received the intent of offer email with some forms to sign.  I have not received the contract yet but hopefully I will receive it soon and I am enthusiastic about the contributions I can make to the audit team.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, why you want to work with us and how your qualifications are going to help you succeed in this role. What are the qualities of a good leader, Tell us about a difficult situation you encountered and how you handled it, there was another one about teamwork but I cannot remember exactly what it was and then I had to answer a question about working in a multicultural environment in French. The interview itself was not difficult because I was well prepared but the tests were difficult.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome)
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to do a written test one month after I applied. I passed the test and was asked to do a phone interview with a panel one week later. Then was offered the position one week later.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background and motivation for working with WFP and what I knew about them. Also wanted to know how my skills/strengths and how it relates to the position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The atmosphere was nice. I applied online and I've been called after one month. The phone interview had a duration or 40 minutes more or less and it was a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Nothing strange: Presentation, Why did I apply...

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Years after I had applied I finally received an email where they wanted to schedule a 30 minutes interview which would be followed by a written segment. 
I found useful info on how to prepare for the interview on the UN website. 
The written segment was an analysis/critique of two of the three main funding systems of WFP
Interview Questions: Do you know what the WFP does?

title: Due Diligence Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1) Online CV and a few questions to be filled, 2) A phone interview from the head of the team in which I was supposed to talk about my motivation for the job and answer how I would write the report if I were assigned to study a company/donor. 3) Last stage is a written test that can be done remotely but has to be sent within the designated time interval in which I was given a company profile and had to find the relevant information regarding any misconduct/lawsuits of the company and to write a short report.
Interview Questions: 1) Motivation, 2) I give you a company name and want you to write a report on it how will you conduct it?

title: Emergency Preparedness Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Food Programme in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email that I would have a phone interview in a month (and this was already a month after I'd applied).  After interview I heard back within a few weeks.  The whole process took about 3 months. They looked at my college classes to make sure that I was properly prepared for this type of interview.  Before the interview I was given a take home assignment to complete that would be discussed in addition to the interview.  The assignment was a little confusing but I managed to complete it almost entirely correctly and they were impressed that I was able to figure it out.  During the interview they asked about my past experience and I if I already knew about the computer programs that would be used during the internship.  Overall they were very nice and the interview was pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions: How my past experience could be applied to this new position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the process took 2 months. Upload my CV on the website, and after couple of months I got an email and we set a phone interview. I had to present myself, demonstrate how my experience and knowledge match the duties and also explain why I had applied to that position and company.
Interview Questions: Nothing special. I was asked to demonstrate specific knowledge vital for that position.

title: Programmer Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: In my case, the process involved an HR officer and a supervisor, and took one hour face-to-face.The people were nice and approachable and the situation was more like a conversation. They did use a competency based approach whereby you had to talk through situations, your ways of dealing with them and the results.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us what you know about the WFP school feeding programme?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Upload my CV on the website, and after a few day, I've been called. The interview was average, behavioral  questions and the atmosphere was peasant. At the end of the interview they asked me if I wanted to join the organization
Interview Questions: Nothing weird, strengths, weakness, previous jobs...

title: Software Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Food Programme (Rome) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for an advertised vacancy. They were quite quick at advising me of reaching the shortlist, which is unusual for the UN. Most of the HR processes were surprisingly quick.

First I had to do a language test in a WFP official language other than English. Or you have to provide evidence of some kind of certification of your language level. I had no such certification so I signed up for a test. 

Little information about the test was provided beforehand. Basically though an external firm was given my phone number and a time to call, which had been agreed with me.  They called almost an hour late however. The test was conducted purely over the phone, so it could only focus on listening and speaking ability - the former particularly not being a strong point for me. The tester would ask a question and you would respond to it. Many of the questions were hypothetical (what would you do if you were outside and it started raining and you had no umbrella? how would you describe the sea to someone who was blind?) and others practical (what will you be doing in 10 years? what did you do on the weekend?). The idea is to make you use various pieces of grammar (conditional, future etc) and also to test if you understand the questions. The language test lasted probably around 20+ minutes.

I struggled a fair bit, but the level required obviously depends on the job and the job I was going for probably did not require a high level. I am at about B1 level in this language and managed to get to the interview stage.

I then was invited to interview in person in Rome at their HQ, with the option of a phone interview instead if I preferred. I went to Rome. I organised the transport and hotel myself, but I was later reimbursed (keep your receipts!).

There were 3 people in the interview - pretty standard in the UN system. The interview started 5-10 minutes late, although one of the panel members turned up only after another 10 minutes or so.

I got the impression that the panel members were not serious and that this was not an open recruitment exercise. Two of them constantly checked their Blackberries during the interview, with one even writing up an email (presumably) during it. This is annoying enough in a meeting, but during an interview it was insulting and lacking in professionalism.

The rest of it went OK, taking about 45-50 minutes consisting of Q&A from both sides. There were no especially tricky questions, but I got the clear impression there was a hole in my CV that meant I would not get the job. I assume that HR must have done the shortlisting, rather than panel members.

My overall impression was poor due to the Blackberry checking. I was left with a sour taste in my mouth regarding the organisation.

As a final sign of this, the position was then re-advertised on the internet without the organisation even having sent me any feedback on my interview. I guess that acts as the rejection email in their eyes!
Interview Questions: How much of your work time would you like to be taken up with technical work?
